word_list.meaning_en: A financial award supporting a student's education, often merit-based.
word_list.meaning_th: ทุนการศึกษาที่มอบให้เพื่อสนับสนุนการเรียน มักอิงผลการเรียนหรือความสามารถ
examples: She secured a scholarship due to her outstanding academic record.
Many applicants rely on scholarships to offset rising tuition fees.
Winning a scholarship can broaden access to higher education for disadvantaged students.

word_list.meaning_en: The subjects and content taught in a course or programme of study.
word_list.meaning_th: หลักสูตรหรือเนื้อหาวิชาที่สอนในรายวิชาหรือโปรแกรมการศึกษา
examples: The national curriculum emphasizes critical thinking over rote learning.
Schools should regularly update their curricula to reflect technological change.
A well-designed curriculum balances theory with practical application.

word_list.meaning_en: The theory and practice of teaching and learning.
word_list.meaning_th: ทฤษฎีและวิธีการสอน
examples: Modern pedagogy encourages student-centred learning.
Effective pedagogy integrates feedback and formative assessment.
Digital tools have transformed traditional pedagogy in many classrooms.

word_list.meaning_en: The ability to read and write; also competence in a specific field.
word_list.meaning_th: ความสามารถในการอ่านเขียน หรือความรอบรู้ในสาขาหนึ่ง
examples: Improving adult literacy can boost employment prospects.
Digital literacy is essential for success in modern workplaces.
National policies aim to close regional literacy gaps.

word_list.meaning_en: Relating to practical training and skills for specific occupations.
word_list.meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับการฝึกทักษะวิชาชีพเชิงปฏิบัติ
examples: Vocational programmes equip students with job-ready skills.
Some argue vocational education is undervalued compared to university degrees.
Apprenticeships provide vocational pathways into high-demand trades.

word_list.meaning_en: Activities outside the regular academic curriculum.
word_list.meaning_th: กิจกรรมนอกหลักสูตร
examples: Extracurricular activities can strengthen university applications.
Debate clubs are popular extracurricular options among high school students.
Time management is crucial when balancing study and extracurricular commitments.

word_list.meaning_en: The process of evaluating students' learning and performance.
word_list.meaning_th: กระบวนการประเมินผลการเรียนรู้ของผู้เรียน
examples: Formative assessment helps teachers adjust instruction in real time.
Standardised assessments may not capture creativity and problem-solving.
A mix of assessment types can provide a fairer picture of ability.

word_list.meaning_en: Using someone else's work or ideas without proper acknowledgment.
word_list.meaning_th: การคัดลอกผลงานหรือความคิดของผู้อื่นโดยไม่อ้างอิง
examples: Universities impose strict penalties for plagiarism.
Software can detect plagiarism in student submissions.
Teaching citation skills reduces unintentional plagiarism.

word_list.meaning_en: A group of students treated as a unit for study or statistics.
word_list.meaning_th: กลุ่มนักศึกษาที่เรียนหรือเก็บสถิติตามรุ่นเดียวกัน
examples: This year's cohort shows higher engagement in online modules.
Outcomes were compared across three cohorts over five years.
Large cohort sizes can strain teaching resources.

word_list.meaning_en: A course or requirement that must be completed before another.
word_list.meaning_th: รายวิชาหรือเงื่อนไขที่ต้องผ่านก่อนลงวิชาถัดไป
examples: Calculus is a prerequisite for advanced engineering modules.
Language proficiency is often a prerequisite for admission.
Removing unnecessary prerequisites can shorten time to graduation.

word_list.meaning_en: A small-group class focused on discussion and interaction.
word_list.meaning_th: ชั้นเรียนกลุ่มย่อยที่เน้นการอภิปราย
examples: Seminars encourage deeper engagement with complex texts.
Attendance at weekly seminars is mandatory in many programmes.
Online seminars can increase access for working students.

word_list.meaning_en: A long essay or thesis submitted for a degree, based on original research.
word_list.meaning_th: วิทยานิพนธ์หรือผลงานวิจัยยาวที่ยื่นเพื่อรับปริญญา
examples: Her dissertation explores climate policy in emerging economies.
Choosing a feasible topic is crucial for a successful dissertation.
The dissertation requires rigorous methodology and ethical approval.

word_list.meaning_en: The academic staff of a university; also a division within a university.
word_list.meaning_th: คณาจารย์ หรือคณะ/ส่วนงานในมหาวิทยาลัย
examples: The faculty voted to revise the grading policy.
She joined the Faculty of Education as a lecturer.
Faculty-student collaboration enhances learning outcomes.

word_list.meaning_en: The act of registering for a course; the number of students registered.
word_list.meaning_th: การลงทะเบียนเรียน หรือจำนวนผู้ลงทะเบียน
examples: Enrollment has surged since the introduction of online options.
Declining enrollment poses financial challenges for small colleges.
Early enrollment can secure access to limited-seating classes.

word_list.meaning_en: The fee paid for instruction; also private teaching.
word_list.meaning_th: ค่าเล่าเรียน หรือการสอนพิเศษ
examples: Rising tuition has intensified student debt.
Some universities freeze tuition to remain competitive.
Private tuition can help bridge learning gaps.

word_list.meaning_en: A sum of money awarded to a student based on need or merit.
word_list.meaning_th: เงินช่วยเหลือ/ทุนการศึกษาจำนวนหนึ่ง มักตามความจำเป็นหรือความดีความชอบ
examples: Low-income students may apply for a bursary.
The college expanded its bursary scheme to improve access.
Bursaries complement scholarships to widen participation.

word_list.meaning_en: Official recognition that an institution or program meets set standards.
word_list.meaning_th: การรับรองมาตรฐานของสถาบันหรือหลักสูตร
examples: Accreditation assures students of programme quality.
Loss of accreditation can severely damage a university's reputation.
External audits form part of the accreditation process.

word_list.meaning_en: Tailoring instruction to meet diverse learners' needs.
word_list.meaning_th: การจัดการเรียนการสอนให้เหมาะสมกับผู้เรียนที่หลากหลาย
examples: Differentiation allows advanced learners to progress more quickly.
Without differentiation, mixed-ability classes may disengage.
Technology can support differentiation through adaptive tasks.

word_list.meaning_en: To provide temporary support to help learners achieve a task.
word_list.meaning_th: การให้โครง/ตัวช่วยชั่วคราวเพื่อสนับสนุนการเรียนรู้
examples: Teachers scaffold complex writing tasks with outlines and models.
Peer feedback can scaffold students’ critical thinking.
As competence grows, the teacher gradually removes the scaffold.

word_list.meaning_en: Relating to assessment that informs ongoing learning, not final grading.
word_list.meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับการประเมินเพื่อพัฒนาการเรียนรู้ระหว่างทาง
examples: Formative feedback should be timely and specific.
Formative tasks reduce anxiety before high-stakes exams.
Most modules include both formative and summative assessments.

word_list.meaning_en: Relating to final evaluation of learning at the end of a unit or course.
word_list.meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับการประเมินผลปลายภาค/ปลายหน่วย
examples: The summative exam accounts for 60% of the final grade.
Projects can serve as authentic summative assessments.
Overreliance on summative testing may narrow the curriculum.

word_list.meaning_en: The act of being present at classes or school.
word_list.meaning_th: การเข้าชั้นเรียน
examples: Poor attendance correlates with lower attainment.
Tracking attendance can identify students at risk of dropping out.
Flexible timetables improved attendance among part-time learners.

word_list.meaning_en: To be admitted to a university or college.
word_list.meaning_th: เข้าศึกษาในมหาวิทยาลัยอย่างเป็นทางการ
examples: Students typically matriculate in September.
International applicants must meet language requirements to matriculate.
She matriculated at a leading research university.

word_list.meaning_en: Intended to teach, often in a moralizing or instructional manner.
word_list.meaning_th: มุ่งสอน หรือแนวสั่งสอน
examples: A didactic approach can feel rigid if overused.
The text is didactic, offering clear lessons for readers.
Balance didactic instruction with inquiry-based learning.

word_list.meaning_en: Driven by questions and exploration rather than direct instruction.
word_list.meaning_th: เน้นการตั้งคำถามและการสำรวจมากกว่าการบอกสอนตรง
examples: Inquiry-based learning fosters curiosity and independence.
Science curricula increasingly adopt inquiry-based projects.
Assessment must align with inquiry-based pedagogy to be effective.

word_list.meaning_en: An outline of topics and requirements for a course.
word_list.meaning_th: เอกสารสรุปหัวข้อและข้อกำหนดของรายวิชา
examples: The syllabus clarifies weekly readings and deadlines.
Students should review the syllabus at the start of term.
Clear syllabi help manage expectations and workload.

word_list.meaning_en: The ability to keep students enrolled; also memory of learned material.
word_list.meaning_th: การคงอยู่ของนักศึกษาในระบบการศึกษา หรือการจดจำความรู้
examples: Scholarship support can improve student retention.
Active recall techniques enhance retention of vocabulary.
Institutions monitor retention rates to evaluate success.

word_list.meaning_en: Intended to improve skills for students who are behind.
word_list.meaning_th: เพื่อปรับพื้นฐานหรือแก้ไขจุดอ่อนของผู้เรียน
examples: Remedial classes target fundamental literacy and numeracy.
Early diagnostic tests can identify students needing remedial support.
Remedial programmes are most effective when tailored to individual needs.

word_list.meaning_en: A high degree of skill or competence in a subject or activity.
word_list.meaning_th: ความชำนาญหรือความสามารถสูง
examples: Language proficiency is essential for academic success.
The test measures reading and writing proficiency separately.
Regular practice is key to improving proficiency.

word_list.meaning_en: A session attended by all participants, often to summarise learning.
word_list.meaning_th: การประชุมรวม/สรุปที่ผู้เข้าร่วมทุกคนเข้าฟัง
examples: The conference opened with a plenary on equity in education.
Plenaries can consolidate key points after group work.
A final plenary allowed students to reflect on outcomes.
